496.text:
It's all kicking off in Malta, British animal
rights activist Bill Oddie has been labelled

500.text:
a "mental case" by the Maltese hunting federation
and the local police questioned BBC presenter

504.text:
Chris Packham.
Mr Packham was campaigning against the spring

510.text:
hunt on the island. The season lasts three
weeks. Police questioned Packham for four

515.text:
hours as he tried to film bird shooting. In
a statement about birdshooting, the Maltese

519.text:
High Commission in London condemned "Publicity-seeking
efforts of individuals" that "do little to

526.text: contribute to this healthy debate constructively."

528.text:
The government of Alberta in Canada is looking
at allowing a new species on the quarry list.

534.text:
After years of lobbying hunters want to be
given permission to hunt sandhill cranes.

540.text:
About 580,000 of the migratory birds nest
or fly over Alberta. Sandhill cranes grow

545.text:
to more than a metre tall with wing spans
of more than two metres.

550.text:
British Pathe has uploaded tens of thousands
of its films dating back to the nineteenth

554.text:
century, and it is a goldmine of hunting and
shooting footage.

558.text:
This film from 1919 shows the Vale Of Aylesbury
with the caption 'What can be more typically

563.text:
English or stir the pulse more, than the grand
old sport of fox-hunting:- even in these modern

570.text:
days'. And this is King Carol and Prince Michael
of Romania pheasant shooting in 1939.

577.text:
The British Conservative party has dropped
its manifesto pledge for a vote on Hunting

582.text:
Act reform. It leaves the field clear for
countryside campaigners to vote for other

586.text:
parties in the upcoming European elections.
The UK Independence Party is courting the

591.text:
rural vote and even the LibDems have dropped
their anti-hunting policies in their new manifesto2015.org

598.text:
website.
Farmers in Italy's South Tyrol region want

602.text:
an end to the local bear hunting ban.
They say the success of an EU project to reintroduce

608.text:
brown bears to northern Italy is causing a
growing threat to their livestock, with bear

612.text:
kills of sheep now widespread.
And finally, this video from Poland definitely

618.text:
carries the kids-don't-try-this-at-home warning.
They have built what appears to be a handheld

Thank you David, next up, Sporting Shooter

655.text:
The Traacker has reached the UK. We covered
the launch of this shot shell at the ShotShow

659.text:
in Las Vegas in January and I had a happy
time giving it a go. Well, now it's time to

665.text:
turn to the experts and we choose Sporting
Shooter editor Dom Holtam to pass his inscrutable

672.text:
Clip: Dom: "These are the AA Traackers, which
should show me why I am missing, instead of

680.text:
just missing, in theory.
"The thing I hate most being a not very good

695.text:
shotgun shooter is when you miss you don't
actually know why you are missing and although

700.text:
there are lots of people in the playground,
you don't know what they're on about and you

705.text:
often get conflicting information whereas
with these tracker shots, they can see really

708.text:
easily when they are looking over your shoulder,
you can even see on a target like this when

713.text:
you shoot yourself. So as a training aid,
to work out why you are missing a particular

716.text:
target and how to remedy it, it seems like
a brilliant idea."

719.text:
Tracer ammunition is fun but expensive. Traacker
is relatively cheap. So how does it work?

725.text:
"The tracker is really distinguished by its
wad , the wad has two very special features.

731.text:
The first is the petals that open up at the
beginning of the wad are larger and they've

735.text:
also got a knotch cut out of the corner, which
makes them aerodynamic and causes the wad

739.text:
to spin and stabilize through spinning. The
second is, it's got a groove in the base of

744.text:
the wad that traps half a dozen, eight pellets
and that weights the back of the wad and keeps

750.text:
it stable. So it will track with the shot
pattern and it will follow further. It won't

755.text:
just drop away from the shot pattern like
most plaz wads will. So you can watch that

759.text:
wad onto the target behind the shot pattern
very clearly and it gives you just that extra

765.text:
edge for the first thirty yards of the course
of the shot. You'll find that you're in line

773.text:
with the pattern and hopefully inline with
the clay or the bird if you happen to want

777.text: to correct yourself on a gameshooting day.

779.text: So, verdict then, you mean shot you.

784.text:
This does actually seem to work. If you're
looking over the shoulder of the shooter you

789.text:
really can see where you're shot spring is
going and if you're missing high you know

791.text:
to give a bit more lead and to get a chance
to prove that here, with some instruction

798.text: and to see it in action is absolutely brilliant.
